intro: Weihea ovata, commonly known as the Tahitian fan palm, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, fan-shaped leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by elongated, woody fruits. Weihea ovata thrives in coastal and lowland areas, often growing in sandy or loamy soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
